sen.j: 道口岐閉国造（みちのくちのきへのくにみやつこ・みちのくちのきへこくぞう)は常陸国北端を支配した国造。
sen.e: Michinokuchinokihenokunimiyatsuko (also known as Michinokuchinokihekokkuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the northern edge of Hitachi Province.
Michinokuchinokihe no kunimiyatsuko 道口岐閉国造 (also known as Michinokuchinokihekokkuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the northern edge of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルと同様の表記にしました。local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Michinokuchinokihe no kunimiyatsuko 道口岐閉国造 (also known as Michinokuchinokihekokkuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the northern edge of Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 道尻岐閉(みちのしりのきへ)国造・岐閇国造とも。
sen.e: It was also called Michinoshirinokihekuninomiyatsuko or Gihenokuninomiyatsuko.
It is also written as 道尻岐閉国造 or 岐閇国造.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルと同様の表記にしました。
sen.e: It is also written as 道尻岐閉国造 or 岐閇国造.

sen.j: 応神天皇朝にその子の宇佐比乃禰が道口岐閉国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: His son Usahinone was appointed Michinokuchinokuchinokihekuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ojin.
His son Usahinone was appointed Michinokuchinokuchinokihe no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ojin.
His son Usahinone was appointed Michinokuchinokuchinokihe no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ojin.
Michinokuchi Go, Taka Gun, Hitachi Province.
